are you trying to attach struts between the bottom craft and the ghosted craft parts above it in your picture?

If that's the case, you won't be able to do it that way. Struts can only attach between parts of the same craft. Since the parts floating above aren't part of the craft you can't strut to them. if you want to make the parts look separated with only the struts connecting them, attached the ghosted part to your decoupler, then use the offset tool to move the ghosted parts up - they're still attached to the decoupler, but will appear suspended some distance above it. Then you'll be able to attach the struts

Well, I'm lacking some time to explain it to you, but this might solve your problem:

  • Place the ghost part horizontally on the probe core
  • Re-root the whole craft so the small cubic strut at the bottom of the ghost part (which is no longer a ghost part at this time) becomes your new root part
  • This should allow you to pick up the probe core and everything below, rotate it by 90° and connect it with the small cubic strut.
  • Re-root the whole craft again so the probecore becomes your root part
  • Rotate the whole craft by 90°
  • done

Welcome to the forums.

What you are trying to do is a little bit tricky. So, here are a couple of things:

You do not want any extra bits attached to your mini-plane. And you are trying to attach the side of your mini-plane to the top of the probe core. Which means that the thing you need on top of your probe core will be a radial decoupler.

Another thing that you need to know is that the ghosted subassembly (your mini-plane) has its own root part. And that part is the only thing on your mini-plane that you can use to attach to something else (like the decoupler).

So the final thing you need to know is that you can use the reroot tool on ghosted subassemblies.

So the steps are going to be: attach a radial decoupler to the top of your probe core. Click the reroot tool. Click your ghosted mini-plane. Click the part (a fuel tank? It's hard to see) that you will be attaching to the radial decoupler. Drag the mini-plane over until that part is touching the radial decoupler, and it should stick on. Then remove any extra bits that you have on your mini-plane -- I think I see a cubic octag stuck on there? Then tweak everything until the placement is perfect.

You're not allowed to radially attach to the turbine. You can only radially attach to the fuel tank that's in front of the turbine. There should be a lot more parts on your mini-plane that you can select with the reroot tool than you say, though.

There is a possibility that one of your mods is blocking it from working correctly, though.

Try the Hardpoint pylon. It works just like a redial decoupler, but it does leave any marks behind (The radial decoupler leaves those three metal points on the parent part)
